verses.verse: The Acceptable Sacrifice A Psalm of Asaph. (Josh 22.22) The mighty one, God the LORD, speaks and summons the earth from the rising of the sun to its setting.
(Deut 33.2; Ps 48.2) Out of Zion, the perfection of beauty, God shines forth.
(Ps 96.13; 97.3; Dan 7.10) Our God comes and does not keep silent; before him is a devouring fire and a mighty tempest all around him.
(Deut 4.26; Isa 1.2) He calls to the heavens above and to the earth, that he may judge his people:
(v 8|PSA 50:8; Ex 24.7) “Gather to me my faithful ones, who made a covenant with me by sacrifice!”
(Ps 75.7; 89.5) The heavens declare his righteousness, for God himself is judge. Selah
(Ps 81.8) “Hear, O my people, and I will speak, O Israel, I will testify against you. I am God, your God.
(Ps 40.6; Hos 6.6) Not for your sacrifices do I rebuke you; your burnt offerings are continually before me.
(Ps 69.31) I will not accept a bull from your house or goats from your folds.
(Ps 104.24) For every wild animal of the forest is mine, the cattle on a thousand hills.
I know all the birds of the air, (Gk Syr Tg: Heb mountains) and all that moves in the field is mine.
(Ex 19.5) “If I were hungry, I would not tell you, for the world and all that is in it is mine.
Do I eat the flesh of bulls or drink the blood of goats?
(Deut 23.21; Heb 13.15) Offer to God a sacrifice of thanksgiving, (Or make thanksgiving your sacrifice to God) and pay your vows to the Most High.
(Ps 81.7; 91.15) Call on me in the day of trouble; I will deliver you, and you shall glorify me.”
(Isa 29.13) But to the wicked God says, “What right have you to recite my statutes or take my covenant on your lips?
(Neh 9.26; Rom 2.21, 22) For you hate discipline, and you cast my words behind you.
(1 Tim 5.22) You make friends with a thief when you see one, and you keep company with adulterers.
You give your mouth free rein for evil, and your tongue frames deceit.
(Mt 10.21) You sit and speak against your kin; you slander your own mother’s child.
(Eccl 8.11) These things you have done, and I have been silent; you thought that I was one just like yourself. But now I rebuke you and lay the charge before you.
(Job 8.13; Ps 7.2; 9.17) Mark this, then, you who forget God, or I will tear you apart, and there will be no one to deliver.
Those who bring thanksgiving as their sacrifice honor me; to those who go the right way, (Heb who set a way) I will show the salvation of God.”
